title: Authors and Citation
text: Bernardo Niebuhr. Author, maintainer. Manuela Panzacchi. Contractor. Neri Thorsen. Contractor. Bram van Moorter. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Niebuhr B, van Moorter B (2024). samtools: Tools handling data databases spatial connectivity modeling.. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://ninanor.github.io/samtools/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {samtools: Tools for handling data and databases for spatial and connectivity modeling.},   author = {Bernardo Niebuhr and Bram {van Moorter}},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://ninanor.github.io/samtools/}, }

what: Tools for handling data and databases for spatial and connectivity modeling.
title: Tools for handling data and databases for spatial and connectivity modeling.
text: samtools provides tools dealing data databases within NINA. special, intended deal SAM (spatial animal movement) database.

title: Tools for handling data and databases for spatial and connectivity modeling.
text: install development version oneimpact R package, please use:

what: Create folder with ODMAP structure — create_odmap
title: Create folder with ODMAP structure — create_odmap
text: function creates empty folder following ODMAP structure (Overview, Data, Modeling, Assessment, Prediction). intended used habitat, movement, connectivity modeling suggested used species (.e. one folder per species), can used ways depending user preferences.

title: Create folder with ODMAP structure — create_odmap
Create folder with ODMAP structure — create_odmap
text: path [character]  Path folder created, including intended folder name. argument provided, structure created current working directory, overwrite [logical(1)=FALSE]  folder overwritten ' already exists? Default FALSE.

title: Create folder with ODMAP structure — create_odmap
code: create_odmap(path = "./test") #> ✔ Creating './test/' #> ✔ Creating './test/01_overview/' #> New project '02_data' is nested inside an existing project './test/', which is rarely a good idea. #> If this is unexpected, the here package has a function, `here::dr_here()` that reveals why './test/' is regarded as a project. #> Error: User input required, but session is not interactive. #> Query: Do you want to create anyway?

what: Helper function to prepare queries to be sent to PostgreSQL — db_make_query
title: Helper function to prepare queries to be sent to PostgreSQL — db_make_query
text: Helper function easily concatenate strings prepare queries PostgreSQL.

title: Helper function to prepare queries to be sent to PostgreSQL — db_make_query
Helper function to prepare queries to be sent to PostgreSQL — db_make_query
text: ... [character]  Strings representing parts query.

title: Helper function to prepare queries to be sent to PostgreSQL — db_make_query
text: string query, used, instance, within DBI::dbExecute().

title: Helper function to prepare queries to be sent to PostgreSQL — db_make_query
code: conditions <- paste0("\"KKOD\" IN ('5011', '5012', '5016', '5017')")  query1 <- db_make_query( "CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS sam_env.roads_public_se AS SELECT * FROM \"Topography\".\"Sweden_Vagkartan_Roads_lines\" WHERE ", paste(conditions, collapse = "AND "), ";") query1 #> [1] "CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS sam_env.roads_public_se AS SELECT * FROM \"Topography\".\"Sweden_Vagkartan_Roads_lines\" WHERE \"KKOD\" IN ('5011', '5012', '5016', '5017');" # to execute, first one needs a connection 'con' to PostgreSQL, then it can be run as # DBI::dbExecute(con, query1)

what: Helper function to read vector layers from PostGIS database — db_read_vect
title: Helper function to read vector layers from PostGIS database — db_read_vect
text: Helper function easily read vector layers PostGIS.

title: Helper function to read vector layers from PostGIS database — db_read_vect
Helper function to read vector layers from PostGIS database — db_read_vect
text: con Connection PostGIS. dsn [character(1)]  Name layer PostGIS database. might contain name schema table, format "schema_name.table_name". return_format [character="sf"]{"sf", "terra"}  Format vector object retrieved. Either "sf" (default) "terra" SpatVector object.

title: Helper function to read vector layers from PostGIS database — db_read_vect
text: return_format = "sf" (default), sf vector object. return_format = "terra", SpatVector object.

what: Summarize number, length, and area of features per area/region — db_summarize
title: Summarize number, length, and area of features per area/region — db_summarize
text: function summarizes number vector features (vector types), total length features (Linestring vectors), total area features (Polygon vectors) within set areas. areas vector layers/variables summarized PostGIS database.

title: Summarize number, length, and area of features per area/region — db_summarize
code: db_summarize(   con,   areas,   variables,   variable_names,   area_geom_col = "geom",   variable_geom_col = "geom",   areas_cols = c("gid", "name_area"),   areas_cols_groupby = areas_cols,   length_unit = c("m", "km")[2],   area_unit = c("m2", "ha", "km2")[3],   return_spatial = TRUE,   verbose = FALSE )

title: Summarize number, length, and area of features per area/region — db_summarize
text: con Connection PostGIS. areas [character]  Areas/polygons summary made. format "schema_name.table_name", representing layer located within PostGIS database. variables [vector,character]  Array layer names summarized, roads, houses, etc. Layers presented format "schema_name.layer_name", representing layers located within PostGIS database. variable_names [vector,character]  Names variables output summary table, corresponding variables parameter. array length variables. area_geom_col [character="geom"]  Character representing name geometry column considered areas layer. variable_geom_col [vector,character="geom"]  Character representing name geometry column considered variables layers. Alternatively, can array length variables, geometry column name variables. areas_cols [vector,character=c("gid", "name_area")]  Array strings name columns represent area ID, define areas areas layer. areas_cols_groupby [vector,character]  Array strings name columns used grouping statistics. Typically (default) area_cols. length_unit [character="m"]{"m", "km"}  Unit summarizing length Linestring vectors. default, "m" (meters). area_unit [character="km2"]{"m2", "ha, "km2"}  Unit summarizing area Polygon vectors. default, "km2" (square kilometers). return_spatial [logical(1)=TRUE]  TRUE (default), results vector areas summaries amount, length, area layers attribute table. FALSE, function returns data.frame area names summary values, spatial component. verbose [logical(1)=FALSE]⁠ messages computation steps printed prompt along computation? Default FALSE.

title: Summarize number, length, and area of features per area/region — db_summarize
text: return_spatial = TRUE (default), function produces vector areas summaries amount, length, area layers attribute table. geometry column geometry areas layer. return_spatial = FALSE, function returns data.frame area names summary values, spatial component.

title: Summarize number, length, and area of features per area/region — db_summarize
code: areas <- "sam_wrein_ancillary.reindeer_areas_official_2023" variables <- c("sam_env.cabins_private_no", "sam_env.roads_private_renrein_no",                "sam_env.reservoirs_all_no") variable_names <- c("cabins_private", "roads_private", "reservoirs") variable_geom_col <- c("geom", "geom", "geom_etrs33") (summ <- db_summarize(con, areas, variables, variables_names,                       variable_geom_col = variable_geom_col,                       return_spatial = FALSE,                       verbose = TRUE)) #> Error in h(simpleError(msg, call)): error in evaluating the argument 'conn' in selecting a method for function 'dbGetQuery': object 'con' not found

what: Helper function to upload vector layers to PostGIS database — db_write_vect
title: Helper function to upload vector layers to PostGIS database — db_write_vect
text: Helper function easily upload vector layers PostGIS, adding primary/unique key possibly comment layer. function also ensures owner layer automatically write modify layer wanted.

title: Helper function to upload vector layers to PostGIS database — db_write_vect
Helper function to upload vector layers to PostGIS database — db_write_vect
text: vect Vector object R, sf format. con Connection PostGIS. dsn [character(1)]  Name layer saved PostGIS database. might contain name schema table, format "schema_name.table_name". pkey_column [character(1)="pkey"]  Name primary key column created. Default "pkey". comment [character=""]  Comment added layer. Typically description layer, processed, source, relevant information.

title: Helper function to upload vector layers to PostGIS database — db_write_vect
text: function return anything, writes de vector PostGIS database.

what: Extract values of raster using in parallel — extract_along
title: Extract values of raster using in parallel — extract_along
text: Function extract values rasters along lines using parallel computation. function actually optimized currently.

title: Extract values of raster using in parallel — extract_along
code: extract_along(   r,   sl,   ws,   col_step_length = "dist",   step_id = "use_ava_data_animals_id",   prefix = "along_" )

title: Extract values of raster using in parallel — extract_along
text: r [SpatRast]  Set rasters, SpatRaster format terra. sl Vector step lines, column representing step id (stratum just step number) LINESTRING geometry step. Can sf SpatVector object. ws List summary statistics computed. Currently, "mean", "max", "min", "sum" implemented. col_step_length [character="dist"]  String name column representing step length. step_id [character="use_ava_data_animals_id"]  String name column representing step ID. prefix [character="along_"]  Prefix added extracted variable names.

what: Set the region in a GRASS GIS session — grass_set_region
title: Set the region in a GRASS GIS session — grass_set_region
text: know arguments, check: https://grass.osgeo.org/grass82/manuals/g.region.html

title: Set the region in a GRASS GIS session — grass_set_region
